item.title: From Junction to Home Farm, 20th February
item.description:
4 large potholes left after last temporary repairs done by GCC. They are opposite the entrance to St Magdalenes house. The workmanship of the potholes filled in by GCC a couple of weeks ago is very poor and uneven.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Blocked storm drain, during the rain water overflows and road is flooded., 20th February
item.description:
The blocked storm drain is on the road near the garage belonging to Ivy Dene property. Issue being present for some time ~ 2 years. Some time ago structural issues(I.e.) cracks appeared on nearby property and therefore raised the concern about blocked drains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Post Office Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised drop curb, 20th February
item.description:
Outside 88 welch road there is a large drop kerb preventing parking on the road. This is making people park on the path especially at school run time.

item.title: 1ft drop from the kerb to the grass verge, 20th February
item.description:

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 20th February
item.description:
06/02/24 email rcvd (full email attached) requesting removal of large tree roots that are growing from a tree into the land between no. 95 & 97 and blocking the installation of a gate post. Also has concerns over the roots causing subsidence at property but is not the main focus of the request.

item.title: Collective potholes, 20th February
item.description:
A triangular area immediately next to brand new resurfacing works on Hucclecote Road where the left fork meets the bypass by Glos Business Park lights. Surely Highways could and should have included this small patch when resurfacing the whole of Hucclecote Road!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate No Through Road sign needs replacing, 20th February
item.description:
At the entrance to Lansdown Terrace Lane on the corner. Nobody realises it is a dead end because the sign is so old/rusty and now covered by Estate Agent boards. Continual traffic zooms up the lane and no decent turning places. A new sign making it clear would help the problem. Sign must be 40 years old!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Terrace Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 20th February
item.description:
There is three potholes and the customer has mentioned that they was reported before but they didn't last that long.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 20th February
item.description:
Good afternoon At 5.15am this morning I was driving down North Road West when I went down a massive pothole. It shook my car really badly and I had to stop and look around the car as I thought I had caused damage. I now have a knocking noise when I turn the wheel which I didn't have before. The impact even made my dash air freshener pop off which is glued on. On my way home I stopped to take the picture attached. 2 workmen there said a supervisor was in his way as they couldn't patch it and the road needs shutting and a bigger patch putting in. What's the next steps as my car is now damaged as a result of this pothole. Regards
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is an ongoing issue with a collapsed pavement in Thai location. After rain the water is gushing out of the hole and running down the carriageway. There is ongoing road resurfacing which will be damaged by this issue. Parish council have asked many times for a resolution to this issue with the pavement, 20th February

item.title: Series of potholes along centre line of carriageway, 19th February
item.description:
On Rookery Road, close to the jcts with Swallow Crescent and Finch Road, a series of potholes along the centre of the carriageway. These individual potholes extend in a line for approximately 20-30 metres.
